rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;27bda283.1503">   <title>International Journal of Design - CFP: Special Issue on Social Design and Innovation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;27bda283.1503</link>   <description> International Journal of Design --- Call For Papers<br><br>Special Issue on Social Design and Innovation<br><br>Full Paper Due : September 10, 2015<br><br>This special issue welcomes articles that focus on theoretical investigations into social design (e.g., history, different paradigms and models), on the methodological challenges of social design (e.g., various models, frameworks and trans-disciplinary insights and cross-fertilization), and on trans-disciplinary examples and implementations of social design innovations. In order to enhance our understanding and development of social design across different societies, either comparative studies or case studies on newly founded social design societies are encouraged. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:26:59+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;27bda283.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;5385a83d.1503">   <title>Planes, trains and automobiles: mechanical engineering archives now online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;5385a83d.1503</link>   <description> Over 1700 images from the archives and historic book collection of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers (IMechE) are now available online via VADS at: http://www.vads.ac.uk/collections/IMECHE<br><br>The archive charts the history of the Institution and of mechanical engineering, covering topics from railways to manufacturing, spanning the late 1800's to the late 1900's. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:37:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Amy Robinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;5385a83d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;13f4bb3f.1503">   <title>Call for papers - Del 2015: Technology, Culture, Practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;13f4bb3f.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;13f4bb3f.1503">Call for papers - Del 2015: Technology, Culture, Practice </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:59:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Webb</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;13f4bb3f.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;eefd2493.1503">   <title>Proceedings of the La Clusaz Conference on Doctoral Education in Design Now Online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;eefd2493.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>David Durling and I have released the proceedings of the La Clusaz Conference on Doctoral Education in Design as an open-access digital edition in .pdf format. This is a page-for-page scan of the original edition.<br><br>Durling, David and Ken Friedman, editors. 2000. Doctoral Education in Design. Foundations for the Future. Proceedings of the La Clusaz Conference, July 8-12, 2000. Stoke-on-Trent, United Kingdom: Staffordshire University Press. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T11:06:16+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;eefd2493.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;c20f3969.1502">   <title>Re: REF Reflections: Arts and Humanities Seminar </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;c20f3969.1502</link>   <description> Please note the message below sent by Yanyan Wang from BCU; contact her (details below) if you have any questions about this seminar.<br><br>On 23/02/2015 12:48, &quot;Yanyan Wang&quot; &lt;yanyan.wang@BCU.AC.UK&lt;mailto:yanyan.wang@BCU.AC.UK&gt;&gt; wrote:<br><br>REF Reflections: Arts and Humanities Seminar<br>Birmingham City University, Parkside Building, Friday 20 March 2015<br>10:00am registration / 10:30 presentations and Q&amp;A / 12:00 lunch and networking [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T13:04:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jenny Embleton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;c20f3969.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e90755e9.1502">   <title>Zombies! Zombies! Zombies! An Interdisciplinary Symposium | 28 February 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e90755e9.1502</link>   <description> Zombies! Zombies! Zombies! An Interdisciplinary Symposium<br>Saturday 28th February 2015 | University of Brighton<br><br>9.30am-4pm, Boardroom M2, Grand Parade Building, University of Brighton<br><br>Confirmed Speakers Include:<br>Naomi Alderman (author of Disobedience, The Liars Gospel and Zombies, Run!)<br>Stacey Abbott (University of Roehampton)<br>Diane Carr (UCL, Institute of Education)<br><br>Zombies are emerging everywhere in popular culture. In comic books and graphic novels, on the small and silver screen, in videogames and board games. The undead have recently risen as a returning figure in contemporary fiction, contaminating works of classic literature, which are themselves reimagined as sequential art and fan fiction. Following [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T14:01:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>SUBSCRIBE MECCSA Anonymous</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e90755e9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;79c65c27.1502">   <title>Updated Research and Writing Resources </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;79c65c27.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>This week, I posted updated versions of several papers on research, research skills, doctoral supervision, research writing, and publishing to my Academia page.<br><br>https://swinburne.academia.edu/KenFriedman<br><br>These papers contain corrections and improvements, along with updated information.<br><br>Please feel free to use these in teaching, research training, and doctoral supervision. You are also free to use them in digital resource collections. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T19:28:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;79c65c27.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b19c63fd.1501">   <title>The Silver Stories Conference: Call for Papers NOW open until 26 FEBRUARY 2015!\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b19c63fd.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b19c63fd.1501">The Silver Stories Conference: Call for Papers NOW open until 26 FEBRUARY 2015!\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-25T22:46:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silver Stories</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b19c63fd.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;117ecba1.1412">   <title>Research Request -- Amended </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;117ecba1.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>With respect to my earlier research request, I should have been more clear. We will published reading lists and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdclassics,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd but we will not be publishing names or personal data.<br><br>My apologies ...<br><br>We will still welcome your answers to the four questions at the bottom of this note. All we need is a short, quick reply. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T00:17:45+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;117ecba1.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d21c969c.1412">   <title>Research Request </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d21c969c.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>To develop background material for the CSIRO Design Capacity Mapping Project, we are asking four quick questions of different groups. The four questions appear at the bottom of this note.<br><br>We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd like the thoughts of list members from the ADM-HEA list. All we need is a short, quick reply.<br><br>Please use the space beneath each question for your answers and post the reply to Heico Wesselius \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the CSIRO Research Fellow \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd off-list at: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T17:54:25+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d21c969c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;11d8c37c.1412">   <title>2nd Call for Contributions: 4th International Visual Methods conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;11d8c37c.1412</link>   <description> The University of Brighton is delighted to host the Fourth International Visual Methods Conference in September 2015. Our programme builds on the foundations laid by the three successful Visual Methods conferences that have taken place at the Open University and the University of Leeds in the UK and at Victoria University in Wellington New Zealand over the past six years. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T13:34:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Visual Methods</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;11d8c37c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;47c3d06f.1412">   <title>Call for Entries Backup-Festival 2015 - EXTENDED DEADLINE - </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;47c3d06f.1412</link>   <description> LAST REMINDER: SUBMIT NOW!<br><br>WE EXTEND THE DEADLINE (due to popular demand) until January 5, 2015! +++ Date of POSTMARK or E-MAIL/LINK!<br><br>Entry form and rules of participation at<br>http://www.backup-festival.de<br><br>Submit your SHORT FILMS (up to 15 min)<br>and MUSIC VIDEOS (up to 7 min).<br><br>The backup_festival 2014 in Weimar searches for short films from students and graduates of art, media, and design colleges. It is a competition that encourages new approaches to the film medium. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-14T21:06:55+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Juliane Fuchs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;47c3d06f.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e85a633e.1412">   <title>CfP: 'Environmental Histories of Design' - workshop at RCC in Munich, 19 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e85a633e.1412</link>   <description> Call for Papers: 'Environmental Histories of Design' - a workshop at Rachel Carson Center for Environment and Society in Munich, 19 June 2015.<br><br>Design and designers hold an ambiguous place in contemporary environmental discourse. They can easily be blamed for causing environmental problems, but also have the competences required for solving those problems. Despite this long-standing centrality of design to environmental discourse, and vice versa, deep and systematic \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdenvironmental histories of design\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd are few and far between. While environmental historians have increasingly explored technology and material culture as active agents in discourses of environmental change, design is seldom explicitly addressed. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-13T13:07:55+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;e85a633e.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d515798a.1412">   <title>DesignX </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d515798a.1412</link>   <description> DesignX<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>The DesignX Collaborative. Collaboratively authored by (in alphabetical order): Ken Friedman, Tongji University College of Design and Innovation and Swinburne University Centre for Design Innovation; Yongqi Lou, Tongji; Don Norman, University of California, San Diego, Design Lab; Pieter Jan Stappers, Delft University of Technology, Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering; Ena Vo\ufffd\ufffdte, Delft; and Patrick Whitney, Illinois Institute of Technology, Institute of Design.   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T23:06:47+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ken Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;d515798a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ce19a76b.1412">   <title>Ethnographic Research Project ADM-HEA Mailing List </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ce19a76b.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I am a student at the joint master program \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDigital Curation\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd at<br>Humboldt Universiatet zu Berlin/King's College London. I am conducting a<br>small ethnographic research project related to digital environments.<br><br>I would like to ask you if you are able to answer some questions about<br>your experience with this mailing list, in order to gain a better<br>awareness and knowledge of the background of subscribers. Then if you<br>will be available, I would like to ask you questions in more depth about<br>the topic. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T10:42:34+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>marchetb</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ce19a76b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;682e24fc.1411">   <title>Call for Writings 'Designing Knowledge Research - Plymouth University. Abstracts by 11th December </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;682e24fc.1411</link>   <description> Please find attached the latest Writing-PAD Centre event from Plymouth University which will be followed by an issue of the JWCP for peer reviewed and selected contributions. If you cannot open the attached I have copied and pasted the main details below. The deadline for abstracts is quite close - December 11th. The Designing Critical Messages Symposium will take place on 16-18th February 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T14:48:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Julia Lockheart</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;682e24fc.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;2e28aa66.1411">   <title>Designing Critical Messages Final Call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;2e28aa66.1411</link>   <description> Designing Critical Messages Symposium February 16/17/18th 2015 with Plymouth University UK<br><br>Design Knowledge Research is situated in the School of Architecture, Design d Environment at Plymouth University UK.<br><br>Final Call for Abstracts: 11th December 2014<br><br>DESIGNING CRITICAL MESSAGES: ENVELOPE: CALL FOR PAPERS<br>People/Spaces/Places/Experiences: This is an international call for papers:<br>The conference begins from the premise that if there is a need for designers to realise that they have to propose something that inspires stakeholders to adopt designsasviable,desirablealternatives,howdoesthisequatedesignprocesses/designthinking/materialityandresearchwriting,inademonstrationof what could become real. This conference is interested in the suggestion that this is part of the skill set that designers better [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-20T21:06:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pete Davis</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;2e28aa66.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ddfd9ff7.1411">   <title>GLAD 2015: Controversy and Conformity </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ddfd9ff7.1411</link>   <description> GLAD:Group for Learning in Art and Design<br><br>Call for Proposals to offer papers and or Workshop at the GLAD Conference 2015<br><br>Date: Friday 27th February 2015<br>Venue: Sheffield Institute of Arts, Sheffield Hallam University<br>One-Day Event starting at 10.30 and finishing at 4.30pm<br><br>GLAD: Controversy and Conformity - 25 years of transforming the academy<br><br>The Group for Learning in Art and Design was formed twenty five years ago in response to changes in higher education which were to impact on how art and design was taught in higher and further education and specialist art schools. Early changes, such as modularisation, [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-19T13:47:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sally Wade</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;ddfd9ff7.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b0aff7f1.1411">   <title>Funded MSc/PhD Studentships at the University of Calgary\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Computation Media Design (CMD) Program (Fall 2015 Admission)</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b0aff7f1.1411</link>   <description> [apologies for cross-postings]<br><br>The Computational Media Design (CMD http://www.ucalgary.ca/cmd/)<br>Graduate Program at the University of Calgary is looking for<br>exceptional MSc/PhD students to join our program in September 2015.<br>Successful applicants will become part of a small group of researchers<br>who are exploring exciting relationships among music, art, design,<br>science and technology.<br><br>The Computational Media Design Graduate program is composed of the<br>Faculty of Arts: School of Creative and Performing Arts - Music and<br>Department of Art, the Faculty of Environmental Design and the<br>Department of Computer Science at the University of Calgary. Students<br>who complete the CMD program earn [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-12T06:27:29-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ehud Sharlin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;b0aff7f1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;cbc0a9c7.1410">   <title>DRS//CUMULUS//Design-ed 2015 Chicago: Learn X Design </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;cbc0a9c7.1410</link>   <description> Dear colleagues, the abstract submission deadline for the upcoming<br>DRS//CUMULUS//Design-ed 2015 Chicago: Learn X Design has been extended<br>to 30 October 2014.<br><br>In additional to already announced partnership with 5 journals listed<br>below we have secured partnership with the Journal of Design, Business &amp;<br>Society.<br><br>We look forward to receiving your submissions!<br><br>Erik   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T22:06:19+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>erik</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;cbc0a9c7.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;a7dc045c.1410">   <title>Call for Contributions 4th International Visual Methods conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;a7dc045c.1410</link>   <description> 16th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 18th September 2015<br><br>University of Brighton<br><br>http://arts.brighton.ac.uk/whats-on/tg/sallis-benney-events/theater-events-2015/september/4th-international-visual-methods-conference-2015<br><br>The International Visual Methods Steering Group are pleased to announce that the next conference will be hosted by the University of Brighton in September 2015. The University of Brighton offers a unique context for the conference, as it brings long-standing traditions of visual arts practice into a dynamic relationship with critical research and scholarship. We believe this will be a productive and intellectually expansive environment in which to extend the visual methods debate within and beyond the academy. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T16:14:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jenny Embleton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;a7dc045c.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;8ca16fa.1410">   <title>Call for Paper abstracts and Workshop/Symposium proposals: The 3rd International Conference for Design Education Researchers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;8ca16fa.1410</link>   <description> Call for Paper abstracts and Workshop/Symposium proposals<br><br>The 3rd International Conference for Design Education Researchers: Learn<br>X Design<br>Chicago, IL USA | 28 June \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 1 July 2015<br><br>The DESIGN-ED Coalition, in partnership with Design Research Society and<br>Cumulus, is excited to announce the Call for Paper abstracts and<br>Workshop/Symposium proposals for the 3rd International Conference for<br>Design Education Researchers: Learn X Design. http://learnxdesign2015.com/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-09T20:53:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>erik</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADM-HEA;8ca16fa.1410</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
